New Records: Pete Alonso launched another homer off Aaron Nola, extending his streak of opposite-field home runs in the playoffs.
Sean Manaea took a two-hit shutout into the eighth inning, earning his first playoff win after a strong performance in the postseason.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched a strong game, escaping major trouble in the sixth inning with crucial strikeouts and a pivotal mound visit.
Pete Alonso sent Aaron Nola's first pitch deep, driving in a run with his second home run of the series.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rob Thomson emphasized the team's resilience and fighting spirit, encouraging the players to focus on one game at a time.
The Mets were playing their first home game in 16 days, adding to the significance of the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rob Thomson praised the team's resilience and toughness, highlighting their ability to play together and fight back.
Pete Alonso expressed excitement about the opportunity to clinch the series at Citi Field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played before a sellout crowd of 44,093, showing strong fan support.
The Phillies were on the brink of an early playoff exit after reaching the World Series the previous year.
Others: The Mets had never clinched a playoff series at Citi Field, making the potential win significant for the team and fans.
